head.title: Even 'Background' Levels Of Radiation Are Harmful

hedline.hl1: Even 'Background' Levels Of Radiation Are Harmful

abstract.p: Miriam Goodman letter, disputing Lewis Friedman's June 4 letter, holds both man-made radiation at Brookhaven National Laboratory and natural radiation are harmful (S)

block.p: In his letter June 4, saying Brookhaven National Laboratory does not cleaning up because the contamination there is no worse than natural background radiation, Lewis Friedman shows he is uninformed about the health effects of ionizing radiation, regardless of source. With respect to cancers and inherited afflictions, natural radiation is no more benign than man-made radiation.
The biologist J. B. S. Haldane suggested in 1948 that perpetual exposure to natural background radiation might account for most of humanity's accumulated burden of inherited disorders.

In his letter June 4, saying Brookhaven National Laboratory does not cleaning up because the contamination there is no worse than natural background radiation, Lewis Friedman shows he is uninformed about the health effects of ionizing radiation, regardless of source. With respect to cancers and inherited afflictions, natural radiation is no more benign than man-made radiation.
The biologist J. B. S. Haldane suggested in 1948 that perpetual exposure to natural background radiation might account for most of humanity's accumulated burden of inherited disorders.

Evidence accumulated since 1955 suggests that very low doses of background radiation probably account for 25 percent or more of a vast group of afflictions that occur because of an inherited predisposition.

Radiation at any level is a uniquely potent cause of chromosome mutations that can lead to so-called irregularly inherited disorders like heart disease, cancer, diabetes, multiple sclerosis, schizophrenia, asthma, rheumatoid arthritis, Alaheimer's disease and many, many more.
